subject: History
title: Who Really Built the Pyramids?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Who Really Built the Pyramids? usable.

hook.text: The pyramids weren't built by slaves or aliens. They were built by well-fed Egyptian workersâ€”and we have their lunches.

buildup.text: In 2010, archaeologists found a workers' village near Giza with bakeries, breweries, and medical facilities.

discovery.text: Workers formed teams with names like Friends of Khufu. They ate beefâ€”a luxury reserved for the well-treated.

twist.text: They likely worked in rotating shifts as a form of labor tax. It was national service, not slavery.

climax.text: The 'mystery' of pyramid construction is mostly solved: ramps, levers, and 20,000 skilled workers over 20 years.

punchline.text: The real builders were workers, not mysteries.

quiz.question: What did the discovery of workers' villages near the pyramids reveal?
options: The pyramids were built by enslaved prisoners of war
Workers were well-fed, organized in teams, and served as labor tax
Foreign engineers from Mesopotamia designed the pyramids
